Hello folks,

Iâ€™ve been building FOCIL visualization into my tool, [**txpool-viz**](https://github.com/punkhazardlabs/txpool-viz), and ran into a challenge Iâ€™d appreciate your input on:

 The logs show inclusion-lists being generated for each slot (after a delay of around 25 blocks) and compared on every new block. However, most blocks are still marked as invalid. When valid inclusion-lists do appear, they only do so for a short period before going back to invalid.

I suspect this might be a performance issue on my end affecting how the kurtosis network behaves locally, but Iâ€™d appreciate any feedback before jumping to conclusions. Docker logs for txpool-viz container should help confirm when inclusion-lists start getting broadcasted.

You can quickly test it using:

```
kurtosis run --enclave my-testnet github.com/punkhazardlabs/ethereum-package@ndeto/feat/add-txpool-viz --args-file focil_params.yaml
```

Use this [focil_params.yaml](https://github.com/punkhazardlabs/txpool-viz/blob/9470e554a6aa87b335e6d934489611ece0baa947/focil_params.yaml) config. `txpool-viz` will be one of the services started by Kurtosis, and its web UI will be exposed in the output.

If you want to test with running nodes. It can also be run as a stand alone tool. Instructions are on the repo [**txpool-viz**](https://github.com/punkhazardlabs/txpool-viz) . I'd also appreciate a couple of devnet beacon urls for testing if it's possible ðŸ™‚ 

Thanks in advance for any insights or tools you can share to help make txpool-viz  reflect EIP-7805 behavior accurately.
